medical_history.chief_complaint: Development of yellowish papules on the neck and other body areas.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began after liver transplantation. In Case 1, yellowish papules were first noted 13 years post-liver transplant. In Case 2, symptoms appeared a few months after transplantation. In Case 3, the mother noted abnormal skin at age 12, worsening after the second transplant.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital biliary atresia, chronic autoimmune hepatitis, hepatic cirrhosis, renal transplant rejection.
medical_history.family_history: Negative for PXE; no signs of PXE in physical examination of parents and siblings.
